body:
When you write, there are 2 available editors are `Rich text` and `Markdown`. 
`Rich text` is good enough if your post is simple but if you want to add more advanced features like table of contents, highlight, alter, ... you should use `Markdown`. 

- - -

## Table of contents

Table of contents will automatically create a list of `Heading 2` and `Heading 3` elements that you can use for quick navigation.

**Syntax**
```
[toc]
```

**Render**
[toc]

- - -

## Headers

**Syntax**
```
# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3
#### Heading 4
##### Heading 5
###### Heading 6
```

**Render**
...
#### Heading 4
##### Heading 5
###### Heading 6

- - -

## Bold

**Syntax**
```
**This text is bold**
__This text is bold, too__
```

**Render**
**This text is bold**
__This text is bold, too__

- - -

## Italic 

**Syntax**
```
*This text is italic*
_This text is italic, too_
```

**Render**
*This text is italic*
_This text is italic, too_

- - -

## Strikethrough

**Syntax**
```
~~This text is strikethrough~~
```

**Render**
~~This text is strikethrough~~

- - -

## Inserted

**Syntax**
```
++This text is inserted++
```

**Render**
++This text is inserted++

- - -

## Marked

**Syntax**
```
==This text is marked==
```

**Render**
==This text is marked==

- - -

## Abbreviation

**Syntax**
```
This is HTML abbreviation example.
It converts "HTML", but keep intact partial entries like "xxxHTMLyyy" and so on.
*[HTML]: Hyper Text Markup Language
```

**Render**
This is HTML abbreviation example.
It converts "HTML", but keep intact partial entries like "xxxHTMLyyy" and so on.
*[HTML]: Hyper Text Markup Language

- - -
## List

### Unordered list

**Syntax**
``` bash
+ Create a list by starting a line with `+`, `-`, or `*`
+ Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces:
  - Marker character change forces new list start:
    * Ac tristique libero volutpat at
    + Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet
    - Nulla volutpat aliquam velit
+ Very easy!
```

**Render**
+ Create a list by starting a line with `+`, `-`, or `*`
+ Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces:
  - Marker character change forces new list start:
    * Ac tristique libero volutpat at
    + Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet
    - Nulla volutpat aliquam velit
+ Very easy!

### Ordered list

**Syntax**
``` bash
1. Use `1` as start index. The next indexes can be set as `1`
1. The next indexes can be set as `1`.  

or 

10. Use a random number as start index.
11. The next indexes should be sequential.
```

**Render**
1. Use `1` as start index. The next indexes can be set as `1`
1. The next indexes can be set as `1`.  

or 

10. Use a random number as start index.
11. The next indexes should be sequential.

- - -

## Horizontal Rules

**Syntax**
```
___
or
---
or
***
```

**Render**

___

or 

---

or

***

## Blockquote

**Syntax**
```
> Blockquotes can also be nested...
>> ...by using additional greater-than signs right next to each other...
> > > ...or with spaces between arrows.
```

**Render**
> Blockquotes can also be nested...
>> ...by using additional greater-than signs right next to each other...
> > > ...or with spaces between arrows.

- - -

## Block code fence
To high-light code based on language, you can add `c`, `json`, `javascript`, `bash` next to the opening fence

**Syntax**
```
` ` ` (no space)
Sample text here...
` ` ` (no space)
```

**Render**
```
Sample text here...
```

- - -

## Inline code

**Syntax**
```
There is an `inline-code` in this sentence.
```

**Render**
There is an `inline-code` in this sentence.

## Link

**Syntax**
```
[Google](https://www.google.com/)
Link with title (hover the link too see its title)
[Google](https://www.google.com/ "Search something")
or you can write a a link like this https://www.google.com/
```

**Render**
[Google](https://www.google.com/)
Link with title (hover the link too see its title)
[Google](https://www.google.com/ "Search something")
or you can write a a link like this https://www.google.com/

- - -

## Image

**Syntax**
```
![Minion](https://octodex.github.com/images/minion.png)
Image with title and size (hover the image too see its title)
![Stormtroopocat](https://octodex.github.com/images/stormtroopocat.jpg "The Stormtroopocat" =50x50)
```

**Render**
![Minion](https://octodex.github.com/images/minion.png)
Image with title and size (hover the image too see its title)
![Stormtroopocat](https://octodex.github.com/images/stormtroopocat.jpg "The Stormtroopocat" =50x50)
- - -

## Table

You can generate markdown table quickly with https://www.tablesgenerator.com/markdown_tables

**Syntax**
```
| Tables   |      Are      |  Cool |
|----------|:-------------:|------:|
| col 1 is |  left-aligned | $1600 |
| col 2 is |    centered   |   $12 |
| col 3 is | right-aligned |    $1 |
```

**Render**
| Tables   |      Are      |  Cool |
|----------|:-------------:|------:|
| col 1 is |  left-aligned | $1600 |
| col 2 is |    centered   |   $12 |
| col 3 is | right-aligned |    $1 |

- - -

## Alter

**Syntax**
```
::: success
Nuclear missile launched.
:::

::: info
This is my number.
:::

::: warning
Someone is behind you.
:::

::: error
Do not text your ex.
:::
```

**Render**
::: success
Nuclear missile launched.
:::

::: info
This is my number.
:::

::: warning
Someone is behind you.
:::

::: error
Do not text your ex.
:::

- - -

## Definition list

You can find all definition list syntax in http://pandoc.org/README.html#definition-lists
**Syntax**
```
Term 1
  ~ Definition 1

Term 2
  ~ Definition 2a
  ~ Definition 2b
```

**Render**

Term 1
  ~ Definition 1

Term 2
  ~ Definition 2a
  ~ Definition 2b

## ASCII Math
Use with block code fence and ASCIIMath keyword
For more syntax, please read up [AsciiMath Documentation](http://asciimath.org/)

**Syntax**
```
` ` `ASCIIMath (no space)
Inline AsciiMath: `@(1/2[1-(1/2)^n])/(1-(1/2))=s_n@`

oint_Cx^3 dx+4y^2 dy

2=(((3-x)xx2)/(3-x))

sum_(m=1)^oosum_(n=1)^oo(m^2 n)/(3^m(m3^n+n3^m)
` ` ` (no space)
```

**Render**
```ASCIIMath
Inline AsciiMath: `@(1/2[1-(1/2)^n])/(1-(1/2))=s_n@`

oint_Cx^3 dx+4y^2 dy

2=(((3-x)xx2)/(3-x))

sum_(m=1)^oosum_(n=1)^oo(m^2 n)/(3^m(m3^n+n3^m)
```
- - -

## Subcription

**Syntax**
```
H~2~O
You can also use inline math: `$H_2O$`
```

**Render**
H~2~O
You can also use inline math: `$H_2O$`

- - -

## Superscript

**Syntax**
```
29^th^
You can also use inline math: `$29^{th}$`
```

**Render**
29^th^
You can also use inline math: `$29^{th}$`

- - -

## Emoji
Please refer to https://github.com/markdown-it/markdown-it-emoji/blob/master/lib/data/full.json
Or you just can search and copy it from [Emojipedia](https://emojipedia.org/)

**Syntax**
```
:panda_face: :sparkles: :camel: :boom: :pig:
:-) :-( 8-) ;)
```

**Render**
:panda_face: :sparkles: :camel: :boom: :pig:
:-) :-( 8-) ;)

- - -

## Footnote
Footnotes will be found at the bottom of this page.

**Syntax**
```
Footnote 1 link[^first].
Footnote 2 link[^second].
Inline footnote^[Text of inline footnote] definition.
Duplicated footnote reference[^second].
[^first]: Footnote **can have markup**
    and multiple paragraphs.
[^second]: Footnote text.
```

**Render**
Footnote 1 link[^first].
Footnote 2 link[^second].
Inline footnote^[Text of inline footnote] definition.
Duplicated footnote reference[^second].
[^first]: Footnote **can have markup**
    and multiple paragraphs.
[^second]: Footnote text.
